p: In recent years, Asia has experienced rapid economic growth and a deteriorating environment coupled with an increase in allergic diseases to epidemic proportions. In the Asia-Pacific region, 2.3 billion people are exposed to levels of air pollution several times higher than the WHO guideline for safe air especially in China and India. Moreover, industrial, traffic-related, and household biomass combustion, indoor pollutants from chemicals, phthalates, and tobacco are major sources of air pollutants, with increasing burden on respiratory allergies.
